posts.title: Van Gogh
posts.excerpt: Quote:VAN GOGH deals with the last three months of the painter’s life. It was shot in Auvers-sur-Oise, a small village 30 kilometres outside Paris where Van Gogh actually spent the last three months of his life (May-July 1890). He had just spent a year at the asylum in Saint Remy and although still suffering from …

posts.title: Searching Eva
posts.excerpt: SynopsisThis is the tale of a young woman, growing up in the age of the internet and turning the search for oneself into a public spectacle, allowing kids from all over the world to live their life through hers. Through her fragmented personalities you see the emergence of a new generation, in which the concept …

posts.title: Öndög
posts.excerpt: Quote: A naked woman is found murdered in the Mongolian steppe. Overnight, a young and inexperienced policeman has to secure the crime scene. Since he is not familiar with the dangers on site, a local herder is sent to guard him and the body. This resolute woman in her mid-thirties knows how to handle a …

posts.title: Immortal
posts.excerpt: Quote:Russian documentary filmmaker Ksenia Okhapkina’s essay portrait looks at the strict order that governs life in a small industrial city in Russia. With her talent for visual composition and perceptiveness regarding local events, she puts together an audiovisual collage of seemingly minor details that enable us to observe a society bound by the regime and …

posts._title: Terry Gilliam & Terry Jones – Monty Python and the Holy Grail (1975)
posts.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:History is turned on its comic head when, in tenth century England, King Arthur (Graham Chapman) travels the countryside to find knights who will join him at the Round Table in Camelot. Gathering up the men is a tale in itself but after a bit of a party at Camelot, many decide to leave only …

posts._title: Vasili Pichul – Malenkaya Vera AKA Little Vera (1988)
posts.title: Malenkaya Vera
posts.excerpt: In 1988 the first Soviet erotic film appeared as a symbol of perestroika. The scenes rather moderate for the genre were shocking for the domestic audiences. On the day of premiere the crowd around Moscow Film House was held back by the police. The film enjoyed international commercial success. Natalia Negoda toured half of the …

posts._title: Joe D’Amato – Emanuelle e Françoise le sorelline AKA Emanuelle’s Revenge AKA Emanuelle and Francoise (1975)
posts.title: Emanuelle e Françoise le sorelline
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Emanuelle (Lindt) is out to avenge her sister (Gori), who committed suicide after escaping from her sadistic lover Carlo (Eastman). posts._title: Lucian Bratu – Un film cu o fata fermecatoare AKA Charming Girl (1966) (HD)
posts.title: Un film cu o fata fermecatoare
posts.excerpt: Ruxandra “Ruxi” Vancu (Margareta Pâslaru) is an aspiring actress. She tries to get into acting school, but they reject her on the basis that she has “too much charm.” She doesn’t give up, however, trying to be a star, even if only in traffic police PSAs. She picks up engineer Şerban Rotaru (Emmerich Schäffer) on …

posts.title: Motion Painting No 1
posts.excerpt: Quote:This experimental film is a study of an abstract painting as it grows out of the mind and soul of the artist and filmmaker. Painstakingly hand-painted in a Impressionist pixel-point style over a period of 9 months (!), and equally laboriously stop-animated, Fischinger captures not only the wonderful decision-making process of the artist at work, …

posts._title: Oskar Fischinger – Studie Nr. 7 AKA Study No. 7 (1931)
posts.title: Studie Nr 7
posts.excerpt: Quote:Animated to the lively accompaniment of Brahms’ Hungarian Dance No. 5, and created using thousands of handmade black & white charcoal drawings, Fischinger’s delightfully dynamic short film sees dozens of white shapes dance, glide, shoot, and pop across a stark black background, leaving us transfixed in their wake.
